newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Sales may improve next week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Sales may improve next week.

text.p: Forecasts for milder weather through the central U.S. next week has some millfeed dealers optimistic sales will increase then.
"It is slow now, but it may improve," said a St Louis dealer.

Frigid cold curbed feed consumption by livestock and in northern areas deep snow blocked roads preventing feed deliveries. Once temperatures moderate dealers expect a surge in demand as ranchers replenish supplies.
Buffalo dealers raised offers $4.00 per ton because of tight supplies for prompt shipment.
Minneapolis sources said outbound shipments of millfeeds were moving well, but trucks bringing wheat from the Dakotas to flour mills were delayed by snow-covered roads.
